content.description: Start in the crack at the lowest point of the wall. Stay right when it splits, then at the third bolt look for a jug that allows you to move out onto the face. Follow bolts to the top.
content.protection: 7 bolts. You could also skip the first couple of bolts and place gear if you really want to.

content.description: Follow the obvious right trending crack on the left side of the wall. The crux comes half height where the crack peters out. There is a bolt here to prevent you from hitting the chockstone if you blow it but feel free to skip it if that sort of thing offends you. Will be better once it cleans up.
content.protection: Single set of cams from .3-3 with doubles .75-2. Shares an anchor with Second Strike. Note that due to the leaning nature of this route, you cannot toprope it without several directionals.
content.location: Scramble up and left from the main base, passing under some chockstones.

content.description: Start with a hard move off the ground to gain the crack then use a hidden slot to head left up the face on beautiful edges.
content.protection: 7 bolts. Shares an anchor with Silver Lining though due to that route's leaning nature, you cannot easily toprope it from them.

content.description: Start slightly right from Thunder Down Under's crack on a scruffy face. Find some nice edges that allow you to gain the upper part of the crack then head up the right side of the headwall on beautiful plates before joining that route again at the anchor. The upper part of this route is the steepest and possibly best section of the wall, shame it isn't longer.
content.location: The right side of the boulders at the base of the crag.

content.description: Start in the crack at the lowest point of the wall, then head follow it left when it splits 10 feet up. Make a tricky move through a hueco to gain the next crack over. Follow this up then head left along an arch to near the anchors of Second Strike. You can finish here but better to clip a bolt and head back right to a cool finish through a roof crack.
content.protection: Double set of cams .3-2. Single 3 for the top. Some longer slings to manage rope drag, especially on the bolt near the top.

content.description: The right side of the right-hand pillar. Continues the wall's theme of right trending cracks and big moves up and left from them.
content.protection: 4 bolts. There is a bolt left near the top to use as a directional if you want to toprope After Dark.

content.description: The left side of the right-hand pillar. Several thin reachy moves get you started then a hard move left at the fourth bolt. For bonus points stay left on the headwall, ignoring the big hole out right that wasn't there prior to cleaning.
